Status.Cause: One or more of the client's search parameters was invalid.
Status.Resolution: If the user formatted the request, prompt the user to retry with different options.

Status.Meaning: An error occurred on the server.
Status.Cause: Server misconfiguration, temporary system issue, or bad item. This is frequently a transient condition.
Access was denied to the resource

Status.Resolution: Reduce the complexity of the query. Prompt user if necessary.
The search timed out. Retry with or without rebuilding results. If it continues, contact the Administrator.

Status.Cause: The folder hierarchy is out of date.
Status.Resolution: Issue a FolderSync command (section 2.2.2.4) and then try the Search command again.

Status.Cause: The requested range has gone past the end of the range of retrievable results.
Status.Resolution: Prompt the user that there are no more results that can be fetched, and the user might consider restricting their search query.

Status.Cause: Access is blocked to the specified resource.
To complete this request, basic credentials are required.
Status.Resolution: If over a trusted connection, supply the basic credentials from the user (prompt if necessary). Otherwise, fail as if the access denied status code was provided.
